goal: Build a React application with component library, state management, and tests

steps.task: Create a backend API server for the React app: (1) Express server with REST endpoints for the main data model, (2) In-memory or file-based storage, (3) CORS enabled for localhost:5173, (4) Input validation. Document API field names clearly for frontend consistency.

Build the React frontend: (1) Create Vite + React + TypeScript project if not exists, (2) Component hierarchy with at least 3 components, (3) State management (useState/useReducer or Zustand), (4) API integration using fetch to call backend endpoints, (5) Loading states and error handling, (6) Configure Vite proxy for /api routes.

Write tests: (1) Unit tests for React components using Vitest + React Testing Library, (2) At least one integration test that verifies frontend calls backend API, (3) Test error states and loading states. Use the same field names as the backend API.
Set up build and deployment: (1) GitHub Actions CI workflow, (2) Production build configuration, (3) Add scripts to package.json for dev, build, test, and start. Do not modify application logic.

Final integration: (1) Verify frontend actually calls backend API (not just local state), (2) Fix any field name mismatches between frontend and backend, (3) Ensure all tests pass, (4) Write README with setup instructions, (5) Add Troubleshooting section to README.
